Protection Under 38 CFR 3.957
Protection from severance of SC is based on
38 U.S.C. 1159
, implemented by
38 CFR 3.957
.
If SC for a disability or cause of death has been in effect 10 or more years, propose severance only if
the original grant was based on fraud, or
it is clearly shown that the person concerned did not have the requisite service or character of discharge (COD).
Important
:  Protection against severance requires continuation of SC status
and
payment of compensation at the appropriate evaluation for the protected condition as if SC was not erroneous, except in cases of willful misconduct or alcohol or drug abuse.
Notes
:
The evaluation of the erroneously-SC-but-protected disability can be increased when supported by the facts.
SC can be established for a condition secondary to erroneously-SC-but-protected disability when supported by the facts.
References
:  For more information on
preservation of SC for a disability eliminated by NSC amputation, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart ii, 3.D.5.c

, and
VAOPGCPREC 6-2002
considering clear and unmistakable error, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 5.A
the prohibition of severance for properly established SC for disabilities associated with abuse of alcohol or drugs on or before October 31, 1990, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart iv, 1.B
, and
willful misconduct based on alcohol and drug abuse, see
38 CFR 3.301
